section.name: Extending UISpec4J
section.p: UISpec4J can be extended to support new kinds of UI components, using the following steps:

ol.li: Implement a wrapper for your component. This wrapper class must extend the UIComponent interface and it must provide one public constructor with the custom Swing class.
Run the ExtensionGenerator class to generate an enhanced UISpec4J JAR
Put the generated JAR in your classpath before the UISpec4J one, so that enhanced classes are taken into account

section.p: Please refer to the ExtensionGenerator Javadoc for more information.

subsection.name: Modified classes

subsection.name: How it works
subsection.p: The extension mechanisms works at the bytecode level, using the ASM library (please refer to the dependencies page for a list of specific JARs to be used). It parses the Panel class loaded from the classpath, and generates the bytecode in the proper section for the two methods.
